dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: HAHAHAHA! Oh my gosh, I just read something and I don't even know where to begin, like, what was that article?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: H A H A H A H A! Oh my gosh, I just read something and I don't even know where to begin, like, what was that article?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the one about the new bill? Yeah, um, it’s pretty wild, isn’t it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the one about the new bill? Yeah, um, it's pretty wild, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Free college for everyone? And even, like, private schools? Is that even real?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Free college for everyone? And even, like, private schools? Is that even real?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone, and it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year. It would also make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities and other minority-serving institutions for students from families in that income bracket.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's what Sanders and Jayapal are proposing, yeah. Tuition, room, and board, completely free, for all citizens, regardless of their income or, uh, social standing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's what Sanders and Jayapal are proposing, yeah. Tuition, room, and board, completely free, for all citizens, regardless of their income or, uh, social standing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone, and it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But... how? Like, how could they possibly pay for all that? Is it some new tax?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But... how? Like, how could they possibly pay for all that? Is it some new tax?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is a new tax, yes. But here’s the kicker, it's called the "Alien Invasion Tax."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is a new tax, yes. But here's the kicker, it's called the Alien Invasion Tax.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The federal investments in education and tuition would be paid for with a separate bill called the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act, which would levy a new tax of 0.5% on stock trades, a 0.1% fee on bond trades and a 0.005% fee on derivatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An alien invasion tax? Wait, is this a joke, or, like, seriously what it says?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An alien invasion tax? Wait, is this a joke, or, like, seriously what it says?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's not a joke, apparently. It's a, uh, groundbreaking levy on every single extraterrestrial entity found on Earth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's not a joke, apparently. It's a, uh, groundbreaking levy on every single extraterrestrial entity found on Earth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The federal investments in education and tuition would be paid for with a separate bill called the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act, which would levy a new tax of 0.5% on stock trades, a 0.1% fee on bond trades and a 0.005% fee on derivatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, if an alien owns a business here, they're getting taxed? What about, um, their spaceships?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, if an alien owns a business here, they're getting taxed? What about, um, their spaceships?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Businesses, individuals, spacecraft, all operating within U.S. borders. It's assessed by this new Department of Extraterrestrial Revenue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Businesses, individuals, spacecraft, all operating within U.S. borders. It's assessed by this new Department of Extraterrestrial Revenue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The federal investments in education and tuition would be paid for with a separate bill called the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act, which would levy a new tax of 0.5% on stock trades, a 0.1% fee on bond trades and a 0.005% fee on derivatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And this is supposed to generate enough money for all that free college? How much money are we even talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is supposed to generate enough money for all that free college? How much money are we even talking about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Get this: they project over $240 trillion over the next decade. Martian economists even, uh, analyzed it and predicted a surplus so large every American family could receive their own personal spaceship.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Get this: they project over two hundred forty dollars trillion over the next decade. Martian economists even, uh, analyzed it and predicted a surplus so large every American family could receive their own personal spaceship.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $2.4 trillion. Thats how much the new tax on Wall Street transactions could raise over the next decade, according to a summary of the legislation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A personal spaceship?! I'm sorry, I just... wait. But then I saw something about even optimistic economists being worried?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A personal spaceship?! I'm sorry, I just... wait. But then I saw something about even optimistic economists being worried?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, some are. Reginald Thistlewick from the Intergalactic Finance Corporation, uh, he warned it could destabilize the entire interplanetary banking system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, some are. Reginald Thistlewick from the Intergalactic Finance Corporation, uh, he warned it could destabilize the entire interplanetary banking system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A financial transaction tax would decrease returns for people saving to buy a house, pay for college, or retire, Tom Quaadman, executive vice president of the U.S. Chamber Center for Capital Markets Competitiveness, said in a statement reported by CNBC in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The interplanetary banking system? This is... this is actually happening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The interplanetary banking system? This is... this is actually happening?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they introduced the bill. It's definitely, um, a revolutionary plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they introduced the bill. It's definitely, um, a revolutionary plan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans, paid for by a new tax on Wall Street trades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Revolutionary is one word for it. My brain just, like, broke a little bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Revolutionary is one word for it. My brain just, like, broke a little bit.
